abstract: Political Memo; partisanship, notwithstanding a contentious debate, makes United States' approval of Iran nuclear deal very likely; formula in Congress represents unspoken attempt by both parties to dodge consequences of gridlock.
lead_paragraph: After an accord between the G.O.P. and the White House, an extraordinary majority would be required to stop action rather than to act.

headline.main: Divisions and Inertia in Congress May Hand Obama a Victory on Iran Deal
headline.print_headline: A Benefit to Iran Deal? Partisanship

snippet: After an accord between the G.O.P. and the White House, an extraordinary majority would be required to stop action rather than to act.
